definition: to patrol/to make one's rounds/classifier for rounds of drinks

sentences.english: Police in flak jackets are patrolling the districts hit by the violence.
sentences.chinese: 身穿防弹衣的警察正在遭受暴力攻击的地段巡逻。
喷气式战斗机在空中侦察巡逻。

sentences.english: The Indian patrol suffered 25 casualties, and the Chinese 33.
sentences.chinese: 印度巡逻队的伤亡人数是25，而中国伤亡了33人。

sentences.english: Border Patrol Special Response Team searches a hotel room-by-room in New Orleans in response to Hurricane Katrina.
sentences.chinese: 边境特别反映巡逻队逐屋搜索新奥尔良的一家旅馆。

sentences.english: The scouts paired off and began to patrol the area.
sentences.chinese: 侦察员们分成两人一组，开始巡逻这一地区。

sentences.english: Officers with dogs then began to patrol the area.
sentences.chinese: 牵警犬的警察随后开始在这一地区巡逻。

sentences.english: Minas Gerais created special teams of police to patrol violent areas.
sentences.chinese: 米纳斯吉纳斯州建立了专门的警队在暴力地区巡逻。

sentences.english: Our advance forces encountered a squad of enemy patrols.
sentences.chinese: 我军的先头部队和敌军的一个班巡逻兵遭遇。

sentences.english: Our patrol on all our fronts contacted no enemy today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我方在各条战线上的巡逻队均未遭遇敌人。

sentences.english: But I'm not lying when I'm laying on the beat.
sentences.chinese: 但我并没有说谎时，我躺在街上巡逻。

sentences.english: A watchman in a building makes rounds.
sentences.chinese: 大楼的看守人进行巡逻。

sentences.english: A patrol car dashboard camera caught the incident on tape.
sentences.chinese: 一辆巡逻车的仪盘表摄像头拍到了这一过程。

sentences.english: It is the primary "heavy" gun carried by SEALs on patrol.
sentences.chinese: 它是海豹突击队在巡逻时主要使用的重型武器。

sentences.english: “Mark and I have the authority to order the scouts on patrol, ” Delia wrote.
sentences.chinese: “马克和我有权力命令巡防队员巡逻，”迪丽娅写到。

sentences.english: The house perfects often snoop around our campus at night.
sentences.chinese: 学生纠察队经常夜间在校园里巡逻。

sentences.english: A shot rang out and galvanized the patrol into action.
sentences.chinese: 枪声一响，使得巡逻兵们立即行动起来。

definition: variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
to warn/to alert/to be on the alert/to stand guard/sentinel
group/a large body of/production brigade/military group
(of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
to investigate a crime/to scout/to reconnoiter/reconnaissance/detection/a scout
to patrol/to make a tour/to inspect/to scan with one's eyes
